The date when Arie Zalmanowicz was killed in captivity following the October 7 attack.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period covering the Hamas attack and the outbreak of the Israel-Hamas conflict, which led to the hostage crisis and ongoing military operations.
The ongoing timeline of the hostage deal, including the return of bodies and prisoner exchanges under the US-brokered ceasefire agreement.

keyTakeAways: Hamas has returned 15 bodies of Israeli hostages under the first phase of a US-brokered ceasefire deal, including those of Arie Zalmanowicz and Master Sgt (res) Tamir Adar.
The bodies were transferred via the International Committee of the Red Cross and escorted into Israel by military forces.
The IDF identified the two deceased hostages, confirming their deaths during the October 7 attack.
Hamas has previously returned a Palestinian body, claiming it was an error due to difficulties locating bodies amid rubble.
The agreement includes a 1:15 exchange of bodies (15 Palestinian bodies for each Israeli hostage), with Israel releasing 250 Palestinian prisoners and 1,718 detainees.
Despite ceasefire terms, violence flared up over the weekend, with both sides accusing each other of breaching the deal.
Israel has launched a military campaign since the October 7 attack, resulting in over 68,000 deaths in Gaza according to Hamas health ministry figures.

namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Nation-state in the Middle East, central to the conflict and the recipient of hostages and military actions.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Israel is the primary nation involved in the hostage crisis, military response, and ceasefire negotiations with Hamas.

namedEntities.name: Hamas
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Palestinian militant organization that launched the October 7 attack and has been involved in hostage transfers and ceasefire negotiations.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hamas is the adversary responsible for the initial attack and is now involved in returning deceased hostages under the ceasefire deal.

namedEntities.name: Arie Zalmanowicz
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An Israeli citizen abducted and killed during the October 7 attack.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His identification confirms one of the deceased hostages returned under the ceasefire agreement, highlighting personal impact of the crisis.

namedEntities.name: Master Sgt (res) Tamir Adar

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His identification underscores the personal loss and bravery of Israeli civilians and soldiers in the conflict.

namedEntities.name: International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Neutral humanitarian organization involved in the transfer of bodies during the hostage crisis.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The ICRC acted as a facilitator in receiving and transferring the bodies of deceased hostages from Hamas to Israel.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Gaza is the location where the bodies of deceased hostages were reportedly found and transferred, and where Israeli military operations have caused extensive destruction.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Under a US-brokered ceasefire agreement, Hamas has returned the remains of 15 deceased Israeli hostages, including Arie Zalmanowicz and Master Sgt (res) Tamir Adar, who were killed during the October 7 Hamas-led attack. The bodies were transferred through the International Committee of the Red Cross and identified by the Israel Defense Forces. The return of these remains marks progress in the ceasefire deal, which also includes the release of over 2,000 Palestinian prisoners and a partial military withdrawal from Gaza. However, controversy persists over Hamas's failure to return all deceased hostages, with accusations of difficulty locating bodies amid rubble. Despite the agreement, violence flared up, and Israel continues to face criticism over the scale of destruction in Gaza, with over 68,000 deaths reported by Hamas health authorities since October 2023.
title: Israel identifies bodies of two hostages returned by Hamas
